channel.title: Hamachi fucked up.. need new way to put rs server online
channel.description:
i started up a older rsps a while back using hamachi and hamachi fucked up and well, now one of my computers cant access the internet -_-
I want a better and safer way to put my server online, i tried using no ip in the past but it never worked.. only thing that has ever worked is hamachi.
please let me know guys, i really love this ps i made and wanna continue playing it but not using hamachi.

item.title: Hamachi fucked up.. need new way to put rs server online
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:550981”][quote author=Zymus link=topic=669895.msg4479444#msg4479444 date=1428609520]

Portforward and use your own PC from home to host, if you’re worried about your “Real IP” going out there, then simply buy a vps, it’s very cheap and it’s on “Discount” at the moment… 1GB, 30GB SSD HDD for about 4bucks, that’s what I payed for. Check it out bud, it’s called; Webkeepers

One thing you should also consider, is that even if you port forward, chances are that you’re required to input your local ip address (10.0.0.20, 192.168.1.175, etc). What a lot of people forget is that, when they set the open port, they specify their current IP address. However, most of the time, their machine is still set to DHCP, so the next time they restart their computer, they may not have the same address. You should specify that your machine get a static address.
[/quote]
There’s two solutions to that (afaik). One, on windows (Unsure about OSX/*Nix) you can go into the network and sharing center and specify a static IP in there, and windows will try to “reserve” that IP. But that isn’t a proper solution, as the computer doesn’t really have a say in the IP address. The most it can do is try. The other solution, and the correct way, would be to reserve the IP address in the router settings. Each router handles this a bit differently, so I can’t say how it would go exactly.[/quote]

Yeah. I’ve only had success with the first option on my Comcast modem+router combo. Setting it on the router level doesn’t work, so i had to go into my adapter settings.

Read full topic
item.source: Hamachi fucked up.. need new way to put rs server online

item.title: Hamachi fucked up.. need new way to put rs server online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Zymus, post:5, topic:550981”][quote author=malimt link=topic=669895.msg4479426#msg4479426 date=1428599397]
Portforward and use your own PC from home to host, if you’re worried about your “Real IP” going out there, then simply buy a vps, it’s very cheap and it’s on “Discount” at the moment… 1GB, 30GB SSD HDD for about 4bucks, that’s what I payed for. Check it out bud, it’s called; Webkeepers
[/quote]

One thing you should also consider, is that even if you port forward, chances are that you’re required to input your local ip address (10.0.0.20, 192.168.1.175, etc). What a lot of people forget is that, when they set the open port, they specify their current IP address. However, most of the time, their machine is still set to DHCP, so the next time they restart their computer, they may not have the same address. You should specify that your machine get a static address.[/quote]
There’s two solutions to that (afaik). One, on windows (Unsure about OSX/*Nix) you can go into the network and sharing center and specify a static IP in there, and windows will try to “reserve” that IP. But that isn’t a proper solution, as the computer doesn’t really have a say in the IP address. The most it can do is try. The other solution, and the correct way, would be to reserve the IP address in the router settings. Each router handles this a bit differently, so I can’t say how it would go exactly.

Read full topic

One thing you should also consider, is that even if you port forward, chances are that you’re required to input your local ip address (10.0.0.20, 192.168.1.175, etc). What a lot of people forget is that, when they set the open port, they specify their current IP address. However, most of the time, their machine is still set to DHCP, so the next time they restart their computer, they may not have the same address. You should specify that your machine get a static address.

item.title: Hamachi fucked up.. need new way to put rs server online
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

Rule number 1: NEVER USE HAMACHI

No-IP isn’t hard to configure on your server. Infact No-IP isn’t even required at all to run your server. If you’re worried you may get DoSed or something, NO-IP will not protect you as people can just ping your NO-IP and find your IP.

Read full topic
